document.docAuthor: Han, Hongxiang, Galsworthy, Anthony C. & Xue, Dayong
document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 165 (4)
document.docTitle: Protuliocnemis dissimilis Han & Galsworthy & Xue 2012, SP. NOV.
document.masterDocTitle: The Comibaenini of China (Geometridae: Geometrinae), with a review of the tribe

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Comibaenini of China (Geometridae: Geometrinae), with a review of the tribe
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: Antenna bipectinate in both sexes, outer rami longer than inner rami, rami much longer in male. Frons green. Labial palpus discoloured in available specimens, possibly green or white. Vertex white. Dorsal side of thorax and abdomen whitish (no fresh material). Hind tibia in both sexes with two pairs of spurs, the medial pair very small.

Forewing length: ♂ 11.5– 13 mm ; ♀ 13–13.5 mm. Wings green. Forewing with costa elongate, apex falcate; antemedial and postmedial lines straight, submarginal line indistinct, concave between medial veins. Hindwing with white postmedial and submarginal lines, the proximal line almost straight, the distal one parallel to outer margin. Both wings without discal spots; fringes white. Underside much paler, streaks on upperside discernible.

Eighth tergite with posterior margin deeply concave at middle, two stout lateral processes, also with their posterior margin slightly concave; eighth sternite with posterior margin slightly concave at middle. Tympanal organ ( Fig. 175 ) very well developed compared with other species in the Comibaenini , and the normal form in the Geometrinae generally; ansa tapering.

Male genitalia. Uncus stout, slightly bifurcate and with two small protrusions. Socii very broad basally and tapering terminally. Gnathos with a small, blunt medial process. Valva narrow, mostly sclerotized, but less so terminally and with a sharply narrowed tip, basally with a long sclerotized process, broadening and blunt at tip. Vinculum short, concave at middle. Aedeagus mostly sclerotized, vesica spinose.
Female genitalia. Antrum very large, funnelshaped, with a small rounded diverticulum. Ductus bursae long and narrow. Corpus bursae quite small; signum absent.

Diagnosis: Protuliocnemis dissimilis
is distinctive in
Protuliocnemis
for the simple wing pattern, and the absence of the tornal and apical patches on the fore- and hindwings. This wing pattern is similar to the members of
Thetidia
, especially the forewing, but the postmedial line of the hindwing is developed in
Pro. dissimilis
and absent in
Thetidia spp.
The male genitalia of
Pro. dissimilis
are similar to those of
Pro. falcipennis
and
Pro. candida
, to the extent that all three species have a simple valva, long basal processes to the valva, and developed socii. However, the basal process to the valva in
Pro. dissimilis
is broader than in the other two species, and the uncus is longer than in
Pro. candida
and not triangular as in
Pro. falcipennis
. The female genitalia are also different from the other two species in that the signum is absent, and the diverticulum is smaller than that of
Pro. candida .

Holotype ♂ , China : Gansu : Wenxian , Qiujiaba ,
2350 m
,
21.vii.1999
, coll. Yao Jian , IZCAS slide no. Geom-00599 ( IZCAS )
.
Paratypes ( IZCAS ): China : 1♂ , same data as holotype
;
2♂ , Gansu : Zhouqu , Shatan Linchang ,
2350 m
,
5.vii.1998
, coll. Yao Jian
;
2♂ 2♀ , same locality and collector,
2400 m
,
14.vii.1999
, IZCAS slide no. Geom-00137, 138, 1074;
1♂ , same locality,
3350–3500 m
,
5.vii.1998
, coll. Yang Xingke
;
1♀ , Gansu : Chengxian , Feilongxia ,
1020 m
,
4.vii.1999
, coll. Yao Jian.
Distribution: China ( Gansu ).

Etymology: The specific name is from the Latin word
dissimilis
, which means different.
